detaileddescription.para: Creates a new BitwiseChromosome with the specified number of objects. The chromosome is made of a bit string encoding objects.

parameterdescription.para: the number of objects the chromosone represents

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new BitwiseChromosome with the specified number of objects and coding.

parameterdescription.para: the number of chromosome coded objects

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new BitwiseChromosome using the specified one as prototype
Returns the BitCoding used by this chromosome
Returns the number of coded objects contained by this chromosome.
Returns the int value at the specified position

parameterdescription.para: the index of the value to return

simplesect.para: the int value at the specified position

detaileddescription.para: Sets the int value at the specified position

parameterdescription.para: the index of the element to be modify

detaileddescription.para: Returns the number of integer used by the chromosome for coding the objects
Returns the object value at the specified position in the chromosome. The value is decoded and returned.
Sets the specified object value at the given position. The object value is encoded and then placed in the chromosome.

parameterdescription.para: the object value to be placed

detaileddescription.para: Returns the bit value at the specified position. This position takes into account the usage of integers made by the coding specification. For instance, if the coding requires 5 bits for each value, index 31 does not point to the last bit of the first integer, but to the second bit of the second integer, as described below
Sets the bit at a given position. Position is related to the bits actually used and not to those occupied by the chromosome data structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (final BitwiseChromosome chromosome, final int from, final int to)
memberdef.name: cross

detaileddescription.para: Exchanges the chromosome bits in the range [from,to]. The range is referred to positions of bits effectively used by the chromosome and not to thoae occupied by the underlying data structure.
Exchanges the chromosome bits from the specified cross site to the final position
Compares the chromosome with another.

simplesect.para: true, if the two chromosome are equal.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the chromosome length expressed in bits. This value can be different from the effective chromosome length (the latter can contain bits used to make the former multiple of Integer#SIZE)
Returns the chromosome length expressed in integers
Randomizes the bit at the given position

parameterdescription.para: the position of bit to alter

detaileddescription.para: Randomizes each chromosome bit
Executes the left shift of bits within the specified range. The shift is circular, so the most right-side bit becomes the first bit on left.
Executes the right shift of bits within the specified range. The shift is circular, so the most left-side bit becomes the last bit on right.
Sets this chromosome as a copy of another.
Sets the default bit value at the a given position
Swaps two bits at given positions
Makes a chromosome copy

memberdef.argsstring: (final int offset, final int index, final BitwiseChromosome chromosome, final boolean after)
memberdef.name: bitcross

detaileddescription.para: Executes the bit exchange starting from the specified point; it is the start point or the final one according to the after flag value. The cross will involve only the bits of the int value containing the bit at the point position

parameterdescription.para: direction, true for crossing after, false for crossing before the specified point

memberdef.argsstring: (final int index, final int from, final int to, final int bit)
memberdef.name: bitshift

detaileddescription.para: Performs right or left shift in a single integer value

parameterdescription.para: the index of the integer where to perform the shift
the integer start bit position for the shift (in this position wil lbe copied the bit value)
the integer final bit position for the shift
the bit to insert for execute the round shift

simplesect.para: the bit value to give at the next integer value

detaileddescription.para: This class provides chromosomes made of bits. Its genome contains objects coded according to a specified BitCoding. Typically objects coded by this chromosome are numeric values. The default integer representation is used when no BitCoding is specified.

A BitwiseChromosome has size and length attributes. The size is the number of coded value contained by its genoma; the length is the number of bits. The length depends on which coding is used for translating objects into bits. The relation between size and length is shown below:
aBitwiseChromosome.length() = aBitwiseChromosome.getSize() * aCoding.SIZE.BITS where aCoding.SIZE.BITS is the number of bits required for coding one object.

This Chromosome performs genetic operations at bit level, processing an array of integer, thus ensuring a high throughput and minimal memory occupation. Using a 16 bit representation, a chromosome holding 4 objects (size) will be represented by 32 bits (length), thus by 2 integers (as each of integer is represented by 32 bit)
